comment:
A nice black and white photo of a person smoking. The framing is nicely done; it has breathing room on the right to bring more focus on the subject. The posing is interesting, slightly slanted for an aesthetic effect.
 
 What needs improvement is the focus of the photo. The right eye is sharper than the left eye, which should be the main focal point as it grabs the most attention. The smoke is also barely visible.
 
 To improve the photo, the photographer should check their gear to see if their lens is front/back focusing. Changing the aperture size to bring the entire face into focus could also work. And finally, a darker background could make the smoke more visible.

explicit_actions.sentence: To improve the photo, the photographer should check their gear to see if their lens is front/back focusing.
explicit_actions.action: Check the gear for front/back focusing issues.

explicit_actions.sentence: Changing the aperture size to bring the entire face into focus could also work.
explicit_actions.action: Change the aperture size to bring the entire face into focus.

explicit_actions.sentence: And finally, a darker background could make the smoke more visible.
explicit_actions.action: Use a darker background to make the smoke more visible.

implicit_actions.sentence: What needs improvement is the focus of the photo.
implicit_actions.action: Improve the focus of the photo.
implicit_actions.flaw: Focus of the photo needs improvement.

implicit_actions.sentence: The right eye is sharper than the left eye, which should be the main focal point as it grabs the most attention.
implicit_actions.action: Ensure the left eye is the main focal point.
implicit_actions.flaw: The right eye is sharper than the left eye.

implicit_actions.sentence: The smoke is also barely visible.
implicit_actions.action: Make the smoke more visible.
implicit_actions.flaw: The smoke is barely visible.

action_concat:
Check the gear for front/back focusing issues.
Change the aperture size to bring the entire face into focus.
Use a darker background to make the smoke more visible.
Improve the focus of the photo.
Ensure the left eye is the main focal point.
Make the smoke more visible.

comment:
Looks like a good "cowboy shot" of a man with a cigarette. The exposure is spot on, it's tack sharp, and there's great texture on the background. The pose is also very good; the cigarette is pointed downwards, so it's more visible.
 
 There is, however, a bit too much negative space on the left. Other than that, it looks solid.
 
 A bit of cropping can solve the excessive space, or you could clone the background on the right with a photo editor so there is more space where the man is facing.

explicit_actions.sentence: A bit of cropping can solve the excessive space, or you could clone the background on the right with a photo editor so there is more space where the man is facing.

Crop the image or clone the background to reduce negative space on the left.
Reduce negative space on the left.

comment:
Cute photo of a bird resting on a branch. The red feathers blend in well with the green background and browns. Its eye is clearly visible and tack sharp. Great use of the rule of thirds.
 
 The background has a bit too much material that reflects; it could be the sky or some shiny leaves.
 
 Not much can be done besides using a photo editor to lower the exposure of the whites (better if edited in a raw file). If this can be re-shot, the photographer can either choose a darker background or simply a solid sky because it's a bit messy right now.

comment:
A pretty yellow flower is set against a green background. It has an interesting composition, mixing in with a second flower to the right. Normally, even-numbered subjects are avoided, but if the size of the subjects differs, it can work.
 
 The problems with the photo are these tiny threads that immediately steal attention, and the blue object that is blurred behind it.
 
 If this can be reshot, the photographer could clean up the flower first and adjust the framing to hide the distracting elements. If not, then any photo editor can make quick work of these white lines.

comment:
A long exposure of a busy city street at nighttime. The composition is good, and there are no complaints about the exposure. The use of the color red from the vehicle lights is great, as it complements the green-lit buildings and dark blue night sky.
 
 The only problems with the image are the noise, a bit of a magenta cast in the sky, and it may need some sharpening.
 
 Shooting with the minimum ISO setting can dramatically lower noise, or you can use a photo editor or plugin that can reduce noise. The pink cast can be toned down using the same editor and selectively brushing those areas.

A beautiful cityscape, all lit up at night. Great details on the building lights and towers, blended in with that nice dark blue sky.
 
 There is, however, a lot of vignetting on the edges, and the wide-angle lens has distorted the horizon. Another distracting element are those overly bright signages on the right.
 
 One could clone out the dark edges, as there is no more detail to lift from those vignettes, and the horizon can be straightened easily with any photo editor. The distracting signages can either be cloned / cropped or re-shot out of the frame.

A metallic-looking mountainside is set against a blue sky. It appears to be part of Horsetail Fall on El Capitan in Yosemite National Park. A bright photo of a waterfall surrounded by lush greens and dense trees. The exposure is lowered significantly so that the white waters won't get any clipping or detail loss. The action is frozen using a fast shutter speed.
 
 While it is refreshing to break a few rules, a frozen waterfall doesn't look that appealing. There is a reason why many experienced photographers recommend shooting waterfalls using long exposures. Of course, many conditions do not allow long exposures, such as cloudless skies or the lack of neutral density filters, which is probably why the shot was done as is.

 The color scheme of the structure (blue and white) suggests the traditional colors used by other churches and buildings nearby. It was also used by the nuns in the Missionaries of Charity where Mother Teresa belonged.
 
 Some would argue that the colors clash a bit with the white, blue, reds, and gold, and it does seem like an unusual color choice.
 
 Everything seems to be in focus here. Not much to change except to add additional sharpening and re-orient the horizon some more so that the cross' horizontal line will be straight.

Consider adjusting the color scheme to reduce clashing.

A photo of a street with various cars parked and moving across the scene, surrounded by string lights and street lamps. It appears to be reaching sunset and is now transitioning to nighttime. People can also be seen walking around the area. An unremarkable composition, there's lots of space in the sky but with nothing artistically interesting in the frame. This may be what people would refer to as a 'snapshot'. 
 
 To improve the scene one might want to re-take the shot at a better angle, perhaps downwards to show more of what is happening with the people and vehicles and to show more of the leading lines that point towards a more festive area at the end of the road.

 Inviting more people to work on the other tools can make this frame a bit more interesting.

A warm photograph of a woman in heels against a suburban background. A rectangular hedge helps support the woman's profile. Streaks of light scatter everywhere as light from the sun bounces from the ground towards the greenery.
 
 It's a very simple portrait with negative space provided by the lens bokeh and, finally, a vanishing point that shows where the woman is headed. A bland but effective photo.
 
 To improve the scene, it's recommended to remove any spots that may be a distraction and apply a healing brush adjustment on the bottom right edge of the screen to remove any dirt on the pavement. The same brush can also be used to reduce the wrinkles from her coat.

comment:
Wide-angle photograph of the aurora borealis set against the foreground of a lake pier with boats. The photograph appears to be shot hurriedly with an in-camera flash, illuminating the boats unflatteringly.
 
 The quality of the shot is poor and riddled with noise from the high ISO setting. It's best to reshoot the scene with better settings. Since the foreground will inevitably be silhouetted anyway, expose for the sky with as minimal ISO as the camera can handle, shot on a tripod. It's okay to keep the shutter speed a bit slower to let in more light, unless the aurora borealis is moving too fast and you don't want any light streaks; then you can opt for a faster shutter speed. Once you have a good shot of the sky, you can optionally expose for the background, shoot long exposures of the lake to keep as much light as you can, and even play around with light painting to illuminate the boats. 
 
 Now, having two photos with varying exposures, blend them altogether in post so that you can keep the well-exposed shot of the sky and, finally, a well-exposed shot of the foreground.

 The shrubbery framing the scene appears well-manicured and maintained, which suggests this could be from some kind of resort or a popular tourist destination.
 
 The problem with the shot right now is the overexposed building to the left. Increasing the shutter speed or using a higher f-stop can help prevent burning the exposure away.

comment:
A saturated long exposure of a waterfall drops down several layers of rocks towards a small river. The extremely vibrant greens and browns make the viewer question whether this photo is real. The whites of the water are heavily subdued, while most signs of shadow are lifted too high, making the image appear like an illustration.
 
 Overly saturated photos can appeal to some people, but not many. While the composition looks fine, the movement of the water is captured well, the colors and the processing work appears overdone. One is reminded of the results of High Dynamic Range (HDR) photography and these results a likely to be the result of such filter or processing. It's recommended to stay away from HDR for now as it's very easy to overcook the images this way.

explicit_actions.sentence: It's recommended to stay away from HDR for now as it's very easy to overcook the images this way.
explicit_actions.action: Avoid using HDR processing to prevent overcooking images.

The frame reveals vast nothingness above the horizon, while the ledge obscures everything underneath, so we will never know what she is looking at.
 
 The subject is placed too far to the edge of the frame; there is such a thing as too much breathing room. To improve the scene, open your favorite photo editor and crop out the unnecessary parts from the right edge, making sure that the final crop places the woman at a third of the photo. It would also help to reduce the whites from the ledge; a single exposure or curves adjustment should do the job.

Hints of Japan are shown on the screen: bright white cherry blossoms beneath a traditional temple painted in red. While the effect looks cool and unique, viewing it at first glance can confuse the viewer. The figure's head appears incomplete, so while the viewer tries to process what's going on with the red limbs, the head starts to reconstruct itself until the full figure is observed. The pink and yellow adds to the chaos. It's understandable this was used for the pop art theme, but it only adds to the confusion; a simpler border would suffice.

A photo of a beautiful riverside landscape, flanked by trees and mountains, against a blue sky.
 
 The river appears abruptly blocked by the massive shadow of a tall tree on the right. Similar blockage is also visible from the rows of trees in the next layer.
 
 For a better, uninterrupted view of the river, it's recommended to shoot with the sun located on the opposite side of the frame. This way, the shadows will fall on the other side and no longer obscure the river details. It's also best to move around a bit so that the next layer of trees are no longer blocking the furthest part of the river.
 
 An alternative solution is to wait for an overcast sky, the clouds will soften the shadows and should no longer interrupt the flow of the scene.

The image captures scoleciphobia, the fear of wriggly things or worms in general. What appears to be an art piece may invoke emotions of fear and discomfort in some people, as the violent wiggling makes it appear like leeches or malicious tentacles. Apparently, this was an art piece by Dale Chihuly entitled "Fiori," or flowers. But despite its innocent name, the alien-like figures resemble parasites, and the vibrant colors suggest a venomous snake.
 
 There's more to this art piece in the frame. It's recommended to either take in all the figures in one frame, or keep this frame as is as a close-up, but remove the cut-off piece to the upper right so it's less distracting.

This effect can be useful for artistic expression, like what's done here; the city now looks like a cozy island with how the buildings appear huddled together. This can be fixed in post; most photo editors have profiles for specific wide-angle lenses that perfectly correct the bending of the buildings. This fix is optional, depending on which look is desired.

A whimsical long exposure photograph captures a misty river flowing along mossy rocks, all littered with a ridiculous amount of yellow and orange leaves. It's as if those leaves were deliberately placed there. The water flow isn't frozen, but it's not too misty either; the shutter speed selection appears just right to show enough movement.
 
 The frame, however, feels like a Dutch angle. It was deliberately tilted to the right so that the frame captures more of the river below. The colors are also overly saturated. This photo may have been processed too much, to the point that it's starting to look like a fairy-tale scene. It's recommended to tone down the colors, unless that was intentional.

 A reshoot of the scene is recommended as there's no rescuing the details of the sky. The golden hour or sunset time is ideal. If one cannot reshoot, there's not much we can do except apply some contrast adjustments on the parts hit by the glare, and maybe a bit more sharpening and vibrancy adjustments.

explicit_actions.sentence: A reshoot of the scene is recommended as there's no rescuing the details of the sky.
explicit_actions.action: Reshoot the scene to capture the sky details.
explicit_actions.flaw: There's no rescuing the details of the sky.

explicit_actions.sentence: The golden hour or sunset time is ideal.
explicit_actions.action: Shoot during golden hour or sunset for ideal lighting.

explicit_actions.action: Apply contrast adjustments, sharpening, and vibrancy to areas affected by glare.

implicit_actions.sentence: The sky is overblown with too much exposure, leaving behind nothing but the glare.
implicit_actions.action: Reduce exposure to prevent overblown sky and glare.
implicit_actions.flaw: The sky is overblown with too much exposure.

action_concat:
Reshoot the scene to capture the sky details.
Shoot during golden hour or sunset for ideal lighting.
Apply contrast adjustments, sharpening, and vibrancy to areas affected by glare.
Reduce exposure to prevent overblown sky and glare.

 The dead branches spike up in all directions, and some of the fallen twigs appear like the limbs of a person sitting around the branches.
 
 One could incorporate more colors by waiting a bit longer until the sky is more orange and fiery.

 One could try to move around some more and find a third shrub below, possibly as another layer of foreground. Completing the rule of odds would make the scene more interesting and should complement our hill some more.

comment:
A wildlife photograph of a bird in flight against a deep blue sky. Further research suggests this is a Gull-billed Tern (Gelochelidon nilotica). It has light grey back and wings with a white underside. Its wings point down as it downstrokes for more lift in the sky.
 
 Using a telephoto lens to capture more detailed wildlife is ideal, so you don't need to crop the frame as much and lose resolution.
 
 To fix this photo, simply crop it using a photo editor to frame the whole bird. This puts more attention on its details and also gets rid of the tree branch on the bottom right edge of the frame.

comment:
A warm, panoramic photo of a sunset scene over a freshwater body of water or river landscape. This appears to be from the Kissimmee River area in Central Florida. The water snakes around the mudflats and submerged aquatic plants. On the horizon are three tall trees of equal height, which could be mistaken for birds in flight.
 
 The composition appears solid; the water curves like leading lines, guiding the viewer's eye toward the sunset. The surrounding dark silhouettes further provide balance and structure to the ground and sky above. The horizon line is also straight. Well done.
 
 The only fix we could recommend is some sharpening on the far edges of the photo.

explicit_actions.sentence: The only fix we could recommend is some sharpening on the far edges of the photo.
explicit_actions.action: Apply sharpening to the far edges of the photo.

 It's a strong composition highlighting the shapes in the form of a towering structure. The blue-green filter is an interesting touch, showing the coldness of this architecture. There is just a gap at the bottom of the frame, which suggests an entrance, that seems to break the pattern a bit. Shooting this slightly to the left could hide that gap.

comment:
A photograph of a cow interrupts the majestic view of mountains ahead. The green grass suggests its feeding ground amidst the rolling hills. The mountain peaks in the background are steep, like massive walls slightly obscured by haze. The sky is blue with clouds that look like they're being blown by the wind.
 
 There's not a lot to comment on this piece. The cow is placed a third of the frame, which is a standard rule of thirds composition. Everything else looks average. Unless there are two more cows to complete the rule of odds, it's recommended to just pick a single subject: the cow or the landscape.

explicit_actions.sentence: Unless there are two more cows to complete the rule of odds, it's recommended to just pick a single subject: the cow or the landscape.
explicit_actions.action: Pick a single subject: either the cow or the landscape.

action_concat: Pick a single subject: either the cow or the landscape.

The contrast between the traditional structure and modern buildings is evidentwooden structures versus marble or cement. White powder surrounds the pathway, suggesting it's winter. The pine trees behind the Torii gate provide a sense of scale.
 
 The details in this photo appear somewhat soft, so it's recommended to sharpen the image using a photo editor.

comment:
A photograph of a woman smiling towards the camera. She wears a beaded necklace and a strapless dress with a geometric design. The sky behind her is blown out; it's a brightly lit day.
 
 In front of her are dry plants and twigs. These remnants of old plant life look like long insect legs. A watermark of the photographer is visible at the bottom left edge of the photo.
 
 The problem with the photo is its focus. The focus point went directly to the twig right in front of the woman's face. This happens a lot when the camera mistakenly locks onto the wrong subject. So, when taking shots like these where the face is partially obscured by plants or other thin objects, always double-check the preview screen to ensure you've nailed the shot.

explicit_actions.sentence: So, when taking shots like these where the face is partially obscured by plants or other thin objects, always double-check the preview screen to ensure you've nailed the shot.
explicit_actions.action: Double-check the preview screen to ensure the focus is correct when the face is partially obscured.

implicit_actions.action: Improve focus on the woman's face.
implicit_actions.flaw: The photo's focus is problematic.

implicit_actions.action: Ensure focus is on the subject, not on objects in front.
implicit_actions.flaw: Focus point is on the twig instead of the woman's face.

implicit_actions.sentence: This happens a lot when the camera mistakenly locks onto the wrong subject.
implicit_actions.action: Prevent camera from locking onto the wrong subject.
implicit_actions.flaw: Camera mistakenly locks onto the wrong subject.

Double-check the preview screen to ensure the focus is correct when the face is partially obscured.

The green shades from the windows and browns of the curved structure beside it blend well with the blue sky above. Upon further research, this appears to be The Zenith Hotel Kuantan in Malaysia.
 
 The brown supports serve a structural or design purpose, or both. Its curved design makes for a wonderful leading line towards the top.
 
 The sky above appears to have some strange bar-shaped streaks near the end of the facade. It could be a rare cloud formation or, most likely, some lens flare. Try removing those using a photo editor.

A long exposure photograph of what appears to be a massive Ferris wheel or some kind of observation wheel. There's a good chance this might be the London Eye, a popular landmark in the River Thames.
 
 The long exposure technique revealed two more prominent subjects on the water: a pair of blue and white-red lit boats navigating along the river. This is great timing and a good implementation of the rule of odds, as the two boats and the wheel all create the number three and even a triangular geometric shape.
 
 The buildings, when zoomed in, appear slightly soft; a quick sharpening pass with any photo editor can make quick work of that.

Under the angel is the message "Seasons Greetings from Seven Dials." The decor is supported by three wires across it. The crisscrossing black wires are interrupted by the white smoke trail of a plane in the sky.
 
 Not an amazing composition, but a decent documentary piece. The only issue is the extra wire on top; too much wire can be a little distracting. Simply use a healing brush over it using any photo editor.

comment:
Pictured here is a woman posing on top of a curvy tree. The curved tree provides a sense of dynamics, as it seems to suggest looking for the curves of the woman beside it. The pose looks relaxed, but since it's taken from below, the perspective shows more of her chin while also making her behind appear a bit bigger. The lighting in that area is also lacking; the shade doesn't give enough light to her face, and looking downward makes it worse.
 
 Recommendations are as follows:
 
 1. Angle her head to look a bit more toward the sky. This will light up her face more and reduce the double chin.
 2. Her left hand is resting flatly on her hip. Have her open or bend her fingers more so it doesn't appear massive.
 3. Her right hand is much too lit by the sun. Ask her to lower that hand a bit so it won't be overexposed.
 Optionally, the photographer can also shoot on top of a stool or ladder, so the model won't have to angle her head.

explicit_actions.sentence: Angle her head to look a bit more toward the sky. This will light up her face more and reduce the double chin.
explicit_actions.action: Angle the model's head to look more toward the sky to light up her face and reduce the double chin.

explicit_actions.sentence: Her left hand is resting flatly on her hip. Have her open or bend her fingers more so it doesn't appear massive.
explicit_actions.action: Have the model open or bend her fingers on her left hand to avoid it appearing massive.

explicit_actions.sentence: Her right hand is much too lit by the sun. Ask her to lower that hand a bit so it won't be overexposed.
explicit_actions.action: Ask the model to lower her right hand to prevent overexposure.

explicit_actions.action: Shoot from a higher position using a stool or ladder to avoid the model having to angle her head.

implicit_actions.action: Adjust the shooting angle to minimize the appearance of the chin and behind.
implicit_actions.flaw: Perspective shows more of her chin and makes her behind appear bigger.

implicit_actions.sentence: The lighting in that area is also lacking; the shade doesn't give enough light to her face, and looking downward makes it worse.
implicit_actions.action: Improve lighting on the model's face to avoid shadows.
implicit_actions.flaw: Lighting is lacking; shade doesn't give enough light to her face.

action_concat:
Angle the model's head to look more toward the sky to light up her face and reduce the double chin.
Have the model open or bend her fingers on her left hand to avoid it appearing massive.
Ask the model to lower her right hand to prevent overexposure.
Shoot from a higher position using a stool or ladder to avoid the model having to angle her head.
Adjust the shooting angle to minimize the appearance of the chin and behind.
Improve lighting on the model's face to avoid shadows.

comment:
A view of a blue lake surrounded by massive pine trees partially reflects snow-covered mountains and clouds lit by the golden glow of the sunset. The blue sky further deepens the colors of the lake. Small tufts of grass in the foreground act as witnesses to the golden spectacle.
 
 It's a simple composition comprised of reflections, color, and layers. However, several parts of the scene are underexposed. The photographer most likely exposed for the sky, which is a good choice, as lifting details from the shadows should be easier than recovering lost highlight details, especially in raw format. Simply open the photo in any photo editor, make a selective adjustment, and lift the exposure of the ground and lake below.

explicit_actions.sentence: Simply open the photo in any photo editor, make a selective adjustment, and lift the exposure of the ground and lake below.
explicit_actions.action: Open the photo in a photo editor, make a selective adjustment, and lift the exposure of the ground and lake.

implicit_actions.flaw: Several parts of the scene are underexposed.

Open the photo in a photo editor, make a selective adjustment, and lift the exposure of the ground and lake.
Address the underexposure in several parts of the scene.

comment:
A photograph shows a man in a collared shirt looking up towards the top left of the frame, his mouth open in amusement or laughter. The lighting appears to be made for portraiture, as the pitch-black background hides everything else. The pose is unusual, as people in portraits don't normally look towards the ceiling or sky like that.
 
 The only recommendation is to reduce the yellows on his teeth. Open a photo editor, do a selective adjustment with HSL (hue, saturation, lightness), target the yellow color range, and drop the saturation a bit. Don't set it to zero, but just enough so that it still looks natural.

comment:
A complicated photo of what appears to be an engine. It looks modified and stylized for a show or performance. The vibrant blue goes well with the chrome, and the chaos of wires is subdued with the similar blue colors all around.
 
 The image appears soft, possibly out of focus even for what looks like a daytime photo out in the sun. Retaking this shot is better than trying to fix the lost details in post. Set a tighter aperture like f/4 or f/8 to cover more details, just don't go any slower than 1/60 or 1/100 of a second so as not to introduce camera shake. If the engine is running and vibrating, then set a higher shutter speed to freeze everything.

explicit_actions.action: Retake the shot to capture details rather than fixing in post.

explicit_actions.sentence: If the engine is running and vibrating, then set a higher shutter speed to freeze everything.
explicit_actions.action: Set a higher shutter speed to freeze motion if the engine is running and vibrating.

Retake the shot to capture details rather than fixing in post.

 It would help to do some additional cropping, removing parts of the sky and the negative space to the right; we need more of the message on the left to be visible. Then, apply some denoising and a final sharpening to finish the piece.

An artificially lit photograph shows a businesswoman in black formal attire with a satisfied expression, walking along a backstreet. An arrow on the asphalt points in her direction. A man in a suit is seen behind her.
 
 The sky is overblown; its overexposure has destroyed all detail.
 
 The woman appears to be lit with a strobe or flash on a diffuser directly above her. This is evident from the light quality and the shadows on her face, which the sun wouldn't normally provide at this angle. The editor added some sun glow around the woman to finish the effect.
 
 Applying a glow effect to the woman is a good workaround to counteract the harsh light of the sky and make it appear part of the photograph. The photo just needs a little more sharpening.

A blurry photograph of a starry night sky shows a blue glow visible on the right of the frame. The four corners of the photo are framed by four white curved shapes, making it look like a picture frame. The dark silhouettes of a group of trees gaze at the celestial bodies above.
 
 This appears to be an attempt at a long exposure; the trees in front probably swayed in the wind, which gave that blurry effect. The stars in the sky also moved.
 
 To freeze the sky, do not exceed twenty or thirty seconds in shutter speed. Anything more, and the stars will appear to move with the Earth's rotation.

explicit_actions.action: Limit shutter speed to twenty or thirty seconds to prevent star movement.

The reflections from the glass are introducing a mess of strange reflections that can confuse the viewer. For example, parts of a couch now appear to be part of the lit highways below.
 
 One can get rid of reflections using a circular polarizer so that the cityscape can be more visible when shot from behind the glass. Or, one can simply raise the camera and take a shot with no obstruction.

A peaceful-looking photograph of a lush landscape filled with grass, trees, and sheep. The feeding ground is lit by the noonday sun under a blue sky with perfect-looking clouds. While exposed for the sky, the shadows still appear pitch black, like a black hole swallowing up some of the sheep.
 
 Sometimes waiting for better light is the right course of action. Wait until the sun is covered by a cloud so it diffuses its light, making it easy to expose for both the sky and the ground.

comment:
A badly exposed HDR (high dynamic range) image of a cityscape in daylight. This is a solid example of how not to use HDR on everything. If exposed for the cityscape below, the foliage should then be in a silhouette, which is perfectly fine. The camera does not have to expose for those details, as our brain understands why it was dark there in the first place.
 
 All the unnecessary HDR use caused a really bad haloing artifact. It would take more time to paint over all the problematic areas in post than to re-shoot the scene properly.

explicit_actions.sentence: If exposed for the cityscape below, the foliage should then be in a silhouette, which is perfectly fine.
explicit_actions.action: Expose for the cityscape and let the foliage be in silhouette.

explicit_actions.sentence: It would take more time to paint over all the problematic areas in post than to re-shoot the scene properly.
explicit_actions.action: Re-shoot the scene properly instead of fixing in post.

implicit_actions.action: Improve exposure settings for HDR cityscape in daylight.
implicit_actions.flaw: Badly exposed HDR image.

implicit_actions.sentence: This is a solid example of how not to use HDR on everything.
implicit_actions.action: Avoid using HDR unnecessarily on all scenes.
implicit_actions.flaw: Improper use of HDR.

implicit_actions.sentence: All the unnecessary HDR use caused a really bad haloing artifact.
implicit_actions.action: Avoid unnecessary HDR use to prevent haloing artifacts.
implicit_actions.flaw: Unnecessary HDR use caused haloing artifact.

action_concat:
Expose for the cityscape and let the foliage be in silhouette.
Re-shoot the scene properly instead of fixing in post.
Improve exposure settings for HDR cityscape in daylight.
Avoid using HDR unnecessarily on all scenes.

A colorful photograph of a landscape under a bridge shows another photographer working with their tripod in the sand. The sky looks almost like a rainbow with its vibrant hues of blue, red, green, and yellow. These otherworldly colors may have been caused by oversaturation or excessive use of HDR (high dynamic range), as white haloing is evident around the bridge. There was also an attempt to lift the already black details of the bridgepossibly to reveal the graffitimaking it less contrasty and unnatural.

To make the graffiti visible with the bridge and sky details, it's recommended to shoot this frame a few minutes later when the sun drops down enough so that the sky is no longer too bright for a long exposure shot. The sky then would no longer have blown out highlights, details of the darks would be lifted up, and you get vibrant sunset colors without the use of HDR as a bonus.

All of this is behind several more buildings in the background, what appears to be a harbor, and some patches of land. The bright bluish haze cuts through the background and the subject.

Taking this shot on a bright day like this is not recommended; the skies are blown out, and harsh shadows are everywhere. The haze can be reduced by waiting for better lighting.

A relaxing photograph of a pristine, snow-covered house beside sets of trees. Its massive lawn space is separated by some dormant bushes as it waits for winter to pass. The overcast sky completes the scene, like a very clean slate.

The photo appears deceptively black and white as the colors of the trees and snow suggest the lack of color and only the textures remain. But the house and bushes still have vibrance left. An interesting optical illusion. 

This photo doesn't need much help, but a bit of sharpening won't hurt.

comment:
Dense sets of foliage and tree trunks line the pathway like a wall or prison bars. Their remarkably even sizes in the center make them appear man-made, but this is deceptively not the case. The browns and greens are mildly complemented by some bluish hues of shrubs below. Bright sets of leaves above and on each edge reveal the chaotic scenes of survival in a forest as each leaf fights for the sun. This is contrasted by some unusually straight lines from the plants at the bottom corner of the photo, fighting in their own way.

It's easy to dismiss this composition as messy, but perhaps it is. One can reach some form of order if they observe enough. The subject is the towering trees, so it's recommended to apply some form of vignette or dodge and burn the other pieces that are not supposed to be given much attention.

explicit_actions.sentence: The subject is the towering trees, so it's recommended to apply some form of vignette or dodge and burn the other pieces that are not supposed to be given much attention.

Simplify composition to reduce perceived messiness.

comment:
A candid photograph of a woman with her mouth open, as if talking or screaming. The subject is strangely placed in the left corner, possibly due to a drunken mistake or abrupt movement.

The in-flash lighting and vintage feel suggest old cameras from the 80s or 90s, or possibly modern retro cameras. In-flash lighting doesn't usually equate to great aesthetics, as it destroys most texture in the photo, but it does flatter human subjects by removing shadows from their faces. However, none of this helps the woman with her strange expression, as the facial muscles create even more shadows that the flash can't remove.

There aren't really any rules for candid shots meant for fun; a bit of cropping would help, but it's no longer necessary.

explicit_actions.sentence: There aren't really any rules for candid shots meant for fun; a bit of cropping would help, but it's no longer necessary.

A high dynamic range (HDR) photograph of a sunset against a vibrant green field dotted by trees. A pathway lays flat on the ground as it cuts across the otherwise pristine landscape.
 
 A well-exposed shot using glass filters can negate the need for a digital filter. Using a graduated neutral density (GND) filter will darken the areas where the sun shines while leaving the greens properly exposed. This technique will prevent the white haloing artifacts that HDR generally produces, which are visible in this photo.

explicit_actions.action: Use glass filters to achieve a well-exposed shot without digital filters.

Prevent white haloing artifacts by avoiding HDR techniques.

comment:
A snapshot of a well-detailed set of graffiti with a man who appears to be hiding underneath. Pink and beige hues fill almost the entire wall, as the unusual caricatures in black juxtapose the usual graffiti styles. The graffiti appears to be done professionally, possibly by the man in the foreground.
 
 Should the man be in the frame? One would say no, unless his tools and paints are clearly visible. If so, we might have a better reason to include him, giving the viewer enough proof that he actually created the artwork.

explicit_actions.sentence: Should the man be in the frame? One would say no, unless his tools and paints are clearly visible. If so, we might have a better reason to include him, giving the viewer enough proof that he actually created the artwork.
explicit_actions.action: Include the man in the frame only if his tools and paints are visible to provide context.

action_concat: Include the man in the frame only if his tools and paints are visible to provide context.

comment:
The world-famous cherry blossoms drape down like leaves frosted in snow against the lush green landscapes. Several people at the bottom right are visible as they admire and take pictures of the flowers.
 
 The blossoms are well-lit from the middle of the frame, while the top parts are slightly obscured by dead branches.
 
 The triangular light below is a bit distracting; perhaps lowering its intensity with a photo or raw editor can help the viewer pay less attention to it. The people below can be left alone; they add scale to the tree in front of them.

explicit_actions.sentence: The triangular light below is a bit distracting; perhaps lowering its intensity with a photo or raw editor can help the viewer pay less attention to it.

comment:
A photograph of a golden retriever going outside the house looking a bit sad. It's strangely the opposite reaction to what a dog would do when going outside on a bright, sunny day. The subject is well-focused, with decent sharpness.
 
 The piece could work with less clutter; the pile of objects beside the sliding door should be removed. If re-shooting is possible, it's best to use a different angle to prevent any stray objects from getting in the frame. And since it's an animal with fine-textured fur, some final sharpening would suffice.

comment:
A stylized photograph of what appears to be a bar or cafe. An electronic sign with the word 'CAIXA' suggests that is the name of the place. Two figures are interacting, appearing to talk to each other.
 
 The frame is aligned against the skewed signboard above, an unusual, or probably accidental, alignment choice. A portion of the man's left arm is visibly tight in the frame.
 
 To make some improvements, it's recommended to clone out that bright spot on the man's black t-shirt and the peeled paint on the blue panel above. This shot can be further cropped to the point that the man's upper left arm is no longer visible; it wasn't that visible to begin with.

comment:
A golden photo of a beachside scene where sun worshippers relax and take in the warm glow. A man in the middle appears to be standing and trying to interact with the women sitting on the sand. Their silhouettes burn through the fiery background of a yellow sky.
 
 The man's head is slightly cut off by a sandbar, revealed by the retreating tides as the sun goes down. This can easily be fixed by raising the camera a bit higher, so that his head is no longer touching the black areas. A final realignment of the horizon should make this piece look a lot better.
